proverb_original: Nna nkui me ngwè
translation_en: The father does not forget his child

proverb_original: A bû a mve
translation_en: Unity is strength

proverb_original: Mekè mve a yé
translation_en: Ask and you shall receive

proverb_original: Nwana me njo
translation_en: A child is a gift

proverb_original: Mve mve n'a mè
translation_en: Small things have big impacts

proverb_original: A bô a ngwè
translation_en: Every person has a responsibility

proverb_original: A yé a mve
translation_en: Patience brings rewards

proverb_original: Nna ma mve
translation_en: Life is a journey

proverb_original: Mvé mve a bô
translation_en: One cannot hide the truth

proverb_original: A bé a mè
translation_en: Help one another

proverb_original: Le léopard est tâcheté, sa queue doit aussi l'être.
translation_en: The leopard is spotted, its tail must be spotted too.

proverb_original: Le chemin qui conduit vers des êtres chers n'a pas d'épines.
translation_en: The path to loved ones has no thorns.

proverb_original: Quand tu lies les mains d'un coupable, il commet une faute avec ses pieds.
translation_en: When you tie a guilty man's hands, he sins with his feet.

proverb_original: Les paroles envolées ne reviennent jamais.
translation_en: Spoken words never return.

proverb_original: Un tronc d'arbre dans l'eau ne devient pas crocodile.
translation_en: A log in water never becomes a crocodile.

proverb_original: À force d'attraper des mouches, on finit par attraper la mouche tsé-tsé.
translation_en: By catching many flies, you end up catching the tsetse.

proverb_original: Le bon bois a toujours des fourmis.
translation_en: Good wood always has ants.

proverb_original: Tout chat accourt lorsqu'il entend miaou.
translation_en: Every cat runs at the sound of meow.

proverb_original: Même le poisson qui vit dans l'eau a soif.
translation_en: Even the fish in water is thirsty.

proverb_original: On n'enterre pas un bouc jusqu'aux cornes.
translation_en: Do not bury a goat up to its horns.

proverb_original: Le cadavre ne craint pas le tombeau.
translation_en: The dead body fears not the grave.

proverb_original: Si tu penses à un rhinocéros, grimpe à un arbre.
translation_en: If you think of rhino, climb a tree.

proverb_original: L'argent est le maïs du diable.
translation_en: Money is the devil's corn.

proverb_original: Tout malin est ignorant qui s'abuse.
translation_en: Every clever one is a fool to himself.

proverb_original: Une main qui va souvent à l'anus finit par porter les excréments.
translation_en: A hand that often goes to the anus ends up with faeces.

proverb_original: Le capricieux ne mange pas ce qui est à point.
translation_en: The capricious does not eat what is ripe.

proverb_original: Fais le mort et tu verras ceux qui t’aiment réellement.
translation_en: Play dead and you'll see who truly loves you.

proverb_original: La chèvre broute là où elle est attachée.
translation_en: The goat grazes where it's tied.

proverb_original: A bird that allows itself to be caught will find a way of escaping.
translation_en: A bird that allows itself to be caught will find a way of escaping.

proverb_original: A building of sand falls as you build it.
translation_en: A building of sand falls as you build it.

proverb_original: A chattering bird builds no nest.
translation_en: A chattering bird builds no nest.

proverb_original: A friend is worth more than a brother.
translation_en: A friend is worth more than a brother.

proverb_original: An elephant will reach to the roof of the house.
translation_en: An elephant will reach the house roof.

proverb_original: Beauty is an empty calabash.
translation_en: Beauty is an empty calabash.

proverb_original: Better a mistake at the beginning than at the end.
translation_en: Better a mistake at the beginning than at the end.

proverb_original: Better little than too little.
translation_en: Better little than too little.

proverb_original: A man's wealth may be superior to him.
translation_en: A man's wealth may be superior to him.

proverb_original: Children are the reward of life.
translation_en: Children are the reward of life.

proverb_original: Rain does not fall on one roof alone.
translation_en: Rain does not fall on one roof alone.

proverb_original: There are no shortcuts to the top of the palm tree.
translation_en: There are no shortcuts to the top of the palm tree.

proverb_original: You do not teach the paths of the forest to an old gorilla.
translation_en: You do not teach forest paths to an old gorilla.

proverb_original: If love is a sickness, patience is the remedy.
translation_en: If love is a sickness, patience is the remedy.

proverb_original: Prepare now for the solutions of tomorrow.
translation_en: Prepare now for the solutions of tomorrow.

proverb_original: Love is like a baby: it needs to be treated tenderly.
translation_en: Love is like a baby: it needs tender care.

proverb_original: No matter how full the river, it still wants to grow.
translation_en: No matter how full the river, it wants to grow.

proverb_original: There is no virgin in a maternity ward.
translation_en: There's no virgin in a maternity ward.

proverb_original: You reap what you sow.
translation_en: You reap what you sow.

proverb_original: The goat that stays put grazes more.
translation_en: The goat that stays put grazes more.

proverb_original: The firewood collected during summer will warm the house in winter.
translation_en: Summer firewood warms in winter.

proverb_original: A clever king is the brother of peace.
translation_en: A clever king is the brother of peace.

proverb_original: Even an ant can hurt an elephant.
translation_en: Even an ant can hurt an elephant.

proverb_original: The jungle is stronger than the elephant.
translation_en: The jungle is stronger than the elephant.

proverb_original: The sun never sets without fresh news.
translation_en: The sun never sets without fresh news.

proverb_original: A single bracelet does not jingle.
translation_en: A single bracelet does not jingle.

proverb_original: There can be no peace without understanding.
translation_en: No peace without understanding.

proverb_original: When you see a woman sitting with her legs open, never tell her to close them.
translation_en: Do not tell a woman to close her legs.

proverb_original: Who works wears clothes.
translation_en: Who works wears clothes.

proverb_original: A bridge is repaired only when someone falls into the water.
translation_en: A bridge is fixed only when someone falls.

proverb_original: Wisdom does not come overnight.
translation_en: Wisdom does not come overnight.

proverb_original: You learn how to cut down trees by cutting them down.
translation_en: You learn by doing.
